concept.title: RELAX NG: Coding requirements for attribute-domain modules
concept.shortdesc: An attribute-domain vocabulary module declares a new attribute specialized from either the props or base attribute.

conbody.p: An attribute-domain module consists of a single file, which has three sections:

dd.p: The contribution to the specializations attribute is documented in the module. The value is constructed according to the rules found in .

The OASIS grammar files use a domainsContribution element to document the contribution; this element is used to help enable generation of DTD and XSD grammar files. An XML comment or a:documentation element also can be used.
The specialized attribute is declared in a pattern named domainName-d-attribute. The attribute is defined as optional.

div.p: For example, the following code samples shows the the audience specialization of props:
div.codeblock: <define name="audienceAtt-d-attribute"> <optional> <attribute name="audience" dita:since="2.0"> <a:documentation>Specifies the audience to which an element applies.</a:documentation> </attribute> </optional> </define>

dd.p: The attribute extension pattern extends either the props or base attribute set pattern to include the attribute specialization.
The pattern is named props-attribute-extensions. The pattern specifies a combine value of interleave, and the content of the pattern is a reference to the specialized-attribute declaration pattern.
The pattern is named base-attribute-extensions. The pattern specifies a combine value of interleave, and the content of the pattern is a reference to the specialized-attribute declaration pattern.
